doc.field: Record Group IV, Series E, pertains to Mary Katherine Horsford's personal and public life in the form of two series arranged by record type. Series 1: Correspondence includes communication in the form of accessories (bracelets), letters, greeting cards, photographs, postcards, printed ephemera, telegrams, and visiting cards. Series 2: Notebooks and Printed Materials consists of private papers in the form of a financial record, a sketchbook, a selection of travel writing, bound research and visitor lists, and original poetry.

Mary Katherine Horsford (1850 - 1927), "Kate" was the second daughter of Mary L'Hommedieu Gardiner Horsford and Eben Norton Horsford. Born in Cambridge, MA, Kate was fond of writing poetry, sketching, and watercolor painting; she also accompanied her father to Europe during his trip to the Vienna Exposition in 1873. Kate never wed and lived at Sylvester Manor with her sister Cornelia Conway Felton Horsford, where she contributed to the ground's garden development.
